wiki.content:
"3am" is the second official single by American rapper Eminem from his upcoming album Relapse. The single was produced by Dr. Dre, along with most of the album, and was released on April 23, 2009 through Shade 45. The song was released onto the iTunes music store April 28, 2009. A music video has been shot, and was released on May 2 at 10:00pm via "Cinemax"
 
 The song deals with darker themes, pitting Eminem as a serial killer as he questions his own sanity and recalls various homicidal incidents. The song, according to Eminem, is said to be closer to the overall sound of the album, as opposed to the poppy, fun-poking "We Made You". It features Eminem presumably rapping from the perspective of his alter ego Slim Shady, utilizing both internal and multi-syllabic rhyme schemes in his three verses.
 
 Eminem quotes a famous line from the movie, The Silence of the Lambs, - "She puts the lotion in the bucket, it puts the lotion on the skin, or else she gets the hose again".[4] This is the third time Eminem uses a reference to The Silence of the Lambs, which was also referred to in the D12 song American Psycho from Devil's Night and the music video for "You Don't Know" from Eminem Presents: The Re-Up with Eminem being restrained in a similar trolley and muzzle to that of Hannibal Lecter's. Eminem also imitates Hannibal Lecter's trademark lip-licking motion to Jodie Foster when, in the beginning of the video, Eminem is visited at his cell by a female FBI Agent who looks similar to Foster's character in The Silence of the Lambs. References to Hannah Montana and Kim Kardashian are also made
 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "3am" is the second official single by American rapper Eminem from his upcoming album Relapse. The single was produced by Dr. Dre, along with most of the album, and was released on April 23, 2009 through Shade 45. The song was released onto the iTunes music store April 28, 2009. A music video has been shot, and was released on May 2 at 10:00pm via "Cinemax"  The song deals with darker themes, pitting Eminem as a serial killer as he questions his own sanity and recalls various homicidal incidents.

track.name: 3AM
comments: I love when he brings up horror movie characters in his raps like hannibal lecter or norman bates from psycho hehe Nicky Minaj has been doing that too lately !!! O_O

While I still enjoy his work from Recovery and on, it's nice that Eminem decided to do something original in the mainstream rap scene for once in the past 10 years with Relapse. This song is gold, period.
crazy.
tell em, davey!
i'm keeping it this way just to spite you.
It's just tagged like this if you got it from the original leak.
skeet
Jeden z lepszych bitów na płycie
Thats right! Chang it to 3 A.M. !
ehm... just look on the album cover, just look at the ad, look on the official website... it's 3 a.m. just get it!

The correct name of this track is Eminem - 3 A.M. and not 3am. Please fix your tags......

ITUNES IS 3am so i think thats right!
grower indeeed....
You have to let this track grow on you. I didn't like it either at first, but then I listened to it alot and I must say it's one of my favorites off of Relapse.
TROLL HARDER DISTANTLAND
Shit sucks. Keeps coming out with the same shit. Nothing new.
it's a grower. I hated this at first but it ain't so bad.
This track is superb, very dark, well produced with razor sharp flowing lyrics - Eminem is so much better when rapping this way.

It's funny, with the video and the chorus the initial impression is of a dark and disturbed track, but the lyrics are actually some of the most hilarious on the album. The darker stuff comes later with Same Song & Dance/Stay Wide Awake.
It's 3 a.m.
Eh.
